translations.idiomatic: Ji Wu Zi did not listen and finally established him.

sentences.zh: 比及葬，三易衰。

translations.literal: By time of burial, three times changed mourning garments.
translations.idiomatic: By the time of the burial, he changed his mourning garments three times.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「是不終也。」

translations.literal: Noble men said: 'This is not completing mourning.'
translations.idiomatic: The noble men said: 'This does not complete the mourning.'

sentences.zh: 昭公三年，朝晉至河，晉平公謝還之，魯恥焉。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong third year, audience Jin arrived river, Jin Ping Gong apologized sent back him, Lu ashamed.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhao's third year, he went to audience Jin but arrived at the river. Duke Ping of Jin apologized and sent him back. Lu was ashamed.

sentences.zh: 四年，楚靈王會諸侯於申，昭公稱病不往。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Chu Ling Wang assembled feudal lords at Shen, Zhao Gong claimed illness not go.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, King Ling of Chu assembled the feudal lords at Shen. Duke Zhao claimed illness and did not go.

sentences.zh: 七年，季武子卒。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Ji Wu Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Ji Wu Zi died.

sentences.zh: 八年，楚靈王就章華臺，召昭公。

translations.literal: Eighth year, Chu Ling Wang completed Zhang Hua Terrace, summoned Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, King Ling of Chu completed the Zhang Hua Terrace and summoned Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 昭公往賀，賜昭公寶器；

translations.literal: Zhao Gong went congratulate, bestowed Zhao Gong treasure vessels;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao went to congratulate him, and he bestowed treasure vessels on Duke Zhao;

sentences.zh: 已而悔，復詐取之。

translations.literal: Already then regretted, again deceitfully took them back.
translations.idiomatic: He then regretted it and again deceitfully took them back.

sentences.zh: 十二年，朝晉至河，晉平公謝還之。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, audience Jin arrived river, Jin Ping Gong apologized sent back him.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he went to audience Jin but arrived at the river. Duke Ping of Jin apologized and sent him back.

sentences.zh: 十三年，楚公子棄疾弒其君靈王，代立。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Chu noble son Qi Ji assassinated their ruler Ling Wang, substituted ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Chu's noble son Qi Ji assassinated their ruler King Ling and substituted in ascending.

sentences.zh: 十五年，朝晉，晉留之葬晉昭公，魯恥之。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, audience Jin, Jin detained him bury Jin Zhao Gong, Lu ashamed it.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, he went to audience Jin, but Jin detained him to bury Duke Zhao of Jin. Lu was ashamed of this.

sentences.zh: 二十年，齊景公與晏子狩竟，因入魯問禮。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, Qi Jing Gong with Yan Zi hunted border, therefore entered Lu asked rites.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Duke Jing of Qi hunted the border with Yan Zi, and therefore entered Lu to ask about rites.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，朝晉至河，晉謝還之。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, audience Jin arrived river, Jin apologized sent back him.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, he went to audience Jin but arrived at the river. Jin apologized and sent him back.

sentences.zh: 二十五年春，鸜鵒來巢。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year spring, qiu yao came nest.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, spring, the qiu yao birds came to nest.

sentences.zh: 師己曰：「文成之世童謠曰『鸜鵒來巢，公在乾侯。

translations.literal: Shi Ji said: 'Wen Cheng time children's rhyme said 'Qiu yao come nest, duke at Qian Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Ji said: 'In Wen Cheng's time, the children's rhyme said: 'The qiu yao come to nest, the duke is at Qian Hou.

sentences.zh: 鸜鵒入處，公在外野』。」

translations.literal: Qiu yao enter dwell, duke outside wild.'
translations.idiomatic: The qiu yao birds enter to dwell, the duke is outside in the wild.'

sentences.zh: 季氏與郈氏鬬雞，季氏芥雞羽，郈氏金距。

translations.literal: Ji clan with Hou clan fought cocks, Ji clan mustard rooster feathers, Hou clan gold spurs.
translations.idiomatic: The Ji clan fought cocks with the Hou clan. The Ji clan had mustard on their rooster's feathers, the Hou clan had gold spurs.

sentences.zh: 季平子怒而侵郈氏，郈昭伯亦怒平子。

translations.literal: Ji Ping Zi angered and invaded Hou clan, Hou Zhao Bo also angered Ping Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ping Zi became angry and invaded the Hou clan. Hou Zhao Bo also became angry with Ping Zi.

sentences.zh: 臧昭伯之弟會偽讒臧氏，匿季氏，臧昭伯囚季氏人。

translations.literal: Zang Zhao Bo's younger brother Hui falsely slandered Zang clan, hid Ji clan, Zang Zhao Bo imprisoned Ji clan people.
translations.idiomatic: Zang Zhao Bo's younger brother Hui falsely slandered the Zang clan and hid with the Ji clan. Zang Zhao Bo imprisoned people of the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 季平子怒，囚臧氏老。

translations.literal: Ji Ping Zi angered, imprisoned Zang clan elders.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ping Zi became angry and imprisoned the Zang clan elders.

sentences.zh: 臧、郈氏以難告昭公。

translations.literal: Zang, Hou clans with difficulty reported Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The Zang and Hou clans reported their difficulties to Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 昭公九月戊戌伐季氏，遂入。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong ninth month wu xu attacked Ji clan, then entered.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao, in the ninth month on day wu-xu, attacked the Ji clan and then entered.

sentences.zh: 平子登臺請曰：「君以讒不察臣罪，誅之，請遷沂上。」

translations.literal: Ping Zi ascended tower pleaded said: 'Lord with slander not examine minister crime, execute him, please move to Yi upper.'
translations.idiomatic: Ping Zi ascended the tower and pleaded, saying: 'My lord, because of slander, does not examine my crime. Execute me, I beg to move to the upper Yi.'

sentences.zh: 弗許。

translations.literal: Not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: He did not permit it.

sentences.zh: 請囚於鄪，弗許。

translations.literal: Requested imprisoned at Mang, not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: He requested to be imprisoned at Mang, but it was not permitted.

sentences.zh: 請以五乘亡，弗許。

translations.literal: Requested with five chariots flee, not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: He requested to flee with five chariots, but it was not permitted.

sentences.zh: 子家駒曰：「君其許之。

translations.literal: Zi Jia Ju said: 'Lord should permit him.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Jia Ju said: 'My lord should permit him.

sentences.zh: 政自季氏久矣，為徒者眾，眾將合謀。」

translations.literal: Government from Ji clan long ago, followers numerous, numerous will join plot.'
translations.idiomatic: Government has been with the Ji clan for a long time. The followers are numerous. The numerous will join together in plotting.'

sentences.zh: 弗聽。

translations.literal: Not listen.
translations.idiomatic: He did not listen.

sentences.zh: 郈氏曰：「必殺之。」

translations.literal: Hou clan said: 'Must kill him.'
translations.idiomatic: The Hou clan said: 'We must kill him.'

sentences.zh: 叔孫氏之臣戾謂其眾曰：「無季氏與有，孰利？」

translations.literal: Shu Sun clan's minister Li told his multitude said: 'Without Ji clan compared to having, which beneficial?'
translations.idiomatic: The Shu Sun clan's minister Li told his multitude, saying: 'Without the Ji clan compared to having them, which is more beneficial?'

sentences.zh: 皆曰：「無季氏是無叔孫氏。」

translations.literal: All said: 'Without Ji clan is without Shu Sun clan.'
translations.idiomatic: All said: 'Without the Ji clan is to be without the Shu Sun clan.'

sentences.zh: 戾曰：「然，救季氏！」

translations.literal: Li said: 'Correct, save Ji clan!'
translations.idiomatic: Li said: 'Correct, save the Ji clan!'

sentences.zh: 遂敗公師。

translations.literal: Then defeated duke's army.
translations.idiomatic: They then defeated the duke's army.

sentences.zh: 孟懿子聞叔孫氏勝，亦殺郈昭伯。

translations.literal: Meng Yi Zi heard Shu Sun clan victory, also killed Hou Zhao Bo.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Yi Zi heard of the Shu Sun clan's victory and also killed Hou Zhao Bo.

sentences.zh: 郈昭伯為公使，故孟氏得之。

translations.literal: Hou Zhao Bo served duke's envoy, therefore Meng clan got him.
translations.idiomatic: Hou Zhao Bo was the duke's envoy, therefore the Meng clan got him.

sentences.zh: 三家共伐公，公遂奔。

translations.literal: Three houses together attacked duke, duke then fled.
translations.idiomatic: The three houses together attacked the duke, and the duke then fled.

sentences.zh: 己亥，公至于齊。

translations.literal: Ji hai, duke arrived at Qi.
translations.idiomatic: On day ji-hai, the duke arrived at Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊景公曰：「請致千社待君。」

translations.literal: Qi Jing Gong said: 'Please deliver thousand she to wait for lord.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing of Qi said: 'I will deliver a thousand she to wait for my lord.'

sentences.zh: 子家曰：「棄周公之業而臣於齊，可乎？」

translations.literal: Zi Jia said: 'Abandon Zhou Gong's enterprise and serve as minister to Qi, possible?'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Jia said: 'To abandon the Duke of Zhou's enterprise and serve as minister to Qi—is this possible?'

sentences.zh: 乃止。

translations.literal: Then stopped.
translations.idiomatic: They then stopped.

sentences.zh: 子家曰：「齊景公無信，不如早之晉。」

translations.literal: Zi Jia said: 'Qi Jing Gong without trust, not as good early to Jin.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Jia said: 'Duke Jing of Qi has no trustworthiness. It would be better to go early to Jin.'

sentences.zh: 弗從。

translations.literal: Not follow.
translations.idiomatic: He did not follow.

sentences.zh: 叔孫見公還，見平子，平子頓首。

translations.literal: Shu Sun saw duke return, saw Ping Zi, Ping Zi knocked head.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Sun saw the duke return and saw Ping Zi. Ping Zi knocked his head (in apology).

sentences.zh: 初欲迎昭公，孟孫、季孫後悔，乃止。

translations.literal: Initially desired welcome Zhao Gong, Meng Sun, Ji Sun later regretted, then stopped.
translations.idiomatic: Initially they desired to welcome Duke Zhao, but Meng Sun and Ji Sun later regretted it and stopped.

sentences.zh: 二十六年春，齊伐魯，取鄆而居昭公焉。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year spring, Qi attacked Lu, took Yun and housed Zhao Gong there.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, spring, Qi attacked Lu, took Yun, and housed Duke Zhao there.

sentences.zh: 夏，齊景公將內公，令無受魯賂。

translations.literal: Summer, Qi Jing Gong will install duke, commanded not accept Lu bribes.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, Duke Jing of Qi was about to install the duke and commanded not to accept Lu bribes.

sentences.zh: 申豐、汝賈許齊臣高龁、子將粟五千庾。

translations.literal: Shen Feng, Ru Jia promised Qi ministers Gao He, Zi Jiang grain five thousand yu.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Feng and Ru Jia promised the Qi ministers Gao He and Zi Jiang five thousand yu of grain.

sentences.zh: 子將言於齊侯曰：「群臣不能事魯君，有異焉。

translations.literal: Zi Jiang spoke to Qi Hou said: 'Multitude ministers cannot serve Lu lord, have strangeness.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Jiang spoke to the Duke of Qi, saying: 'The multitude of ministers cannot serve the Lu lord. There is strangeness.

sentences.zh: 宋元公為魯如晉，求內之，道卒。

translations.literal: Song Yuan Gong for Lu went to Jin, sought install him, road died.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Yuan of Song, for Lu's sake, went to Jin to seek installing him, but died on the road.

sentences.zh: 叔孫昭子求內其君，無病而死。

translations.literal: Shu Sun Zhao Zi sought install their lord, without illness died.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Sun Zhao Zi sought to install their lord, but died without illness.

sentences.zh: 不知天棄魯乎？

translations.literal: Not know heaven abandon Lu?
translations.idiomatic: I do not know if heaven has abandoned Lu?

sentences.zh: 抑魯君有罪于鬼神也？

translations.literal: Or Lu lord has crime toward ghosts spirits?
translations.idiomatic: Or does the Lu lord have crimes toward the ghosts and spirits?

sentences.zh: 願君且待。」

translations.literal: Wish lord temporarily wait.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish my lord to temporarily wait.'

sentences.zh: 齊景公從之。

translations.literal: Qi Jing Gong followed it.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing of Qi followed this.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，昭公如晉，求入。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, Zhao Gong went to Jin, sought entry.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Zhao went to Jin seeking entry.

sentences.zh: 季平子私於晉六卿，六卿受季氏賂，諫晉君，晉君乃止，居昭公乾侯。

translations.literal: Ji Ping Zi privately with Jin six qing, six qing received Ji clan bribes, admonished Jin lord, Jin lord then stopped, housed Zhao Gong Qian Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ping Zi privately dealt with Jin's six ministers. The six ministers received Ji clan bribes and admonished the Jin lord. The Jin lord then stopped and housed Duke Zhao at Qian Hou.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，昭公如鄆。

translations.literal: Twenty-ninth year, Zhao Gong went to Yun.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Zhao went to Yun.

sentences.zh: 齊景公使人賜昭公書，自謂「主君」。

translations.literal: Qi Jing Gong made people bestow Zhao Gong writings, self called 'master lord'.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing of Qi had people bestow writings on Duke Zhao, calling himself 'master lord'.

sentences.zh: 昭公恥之，怒而去乾侯。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong ashamed it, angered and left Qian Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao was ashamed by it, angered, and left Qian Hou.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，晉欲內昭公，召季平子。

translations.literal: Thirty-first year, Jin desired install Zhao Gong, summoned Ji Ping Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Jin desired to install Duke Zhao and summoned Ji Ping Zi.

sentences.zh: 平子布衣跣行，因六卿謝罪。

translations.literal: Ping Zi plain clothes barefoot walked, through six ministers apologized for crime.
translations.idiomatic: Ping Zi, in plain clothes and barefoot, went through the six ministers apologizing for the crime.

sentences.zh: 六卿為言曰：「晉欲內昭公，眾不從。」

translations.literal: Six ministers spoke said: 'Jin desires install Zhao Gong, multitude not follow.'
translations.idiomatic: The six ministers spoke, saying: 'Jin desires to install Duke Zhao, but the multitude will not follow.'

sentences.zh: 晉人止。

translations.literal: Jin people stopped.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people stopped.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，昭公卒於乾侯。

translations.literal: Thirty-second year, Zhao Gong died at Qian Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, Duke Zhao died at Qian Hou.

sentences.zh: 魯人共立昭公弟宋為君，是為定公。

translations.literal: Lu people together established Zhao Gong younger brother Song as ruler, this was Ding Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The Lu people together established Duke Zhao's younger brother Song as ruler, who became Duke Ding.

sentences.zh: 定公立，趙簡子問史墨曰：「季氏亡乎？」

translations.literal: Ding Gong established, Zhao Jian Zi asked Shi Mo said: 'Ji clan perish?'
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Ding was established, Zhao Jian Zi asked Shi Mo, saying: 'Will the Ji clan perish?'

sentences.zh: 史墨對曰：「不亡。

translations.literal: Shi Mo replied said: 'Not perish.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Mo replied, saying: 'They will not perish.

sentences.zh: 季友有大功於魯，受鄪為上卿，至于文子、武子，世增其業。

translations.literal: Ji You had great merit in Lu, received Mang as chief minister, to Wen Zi, Wu Zi, generations increased their enterprise.
translations.idiomatic: Ji You had great merit in Lu, received Mang as chief minister. Down to Wen Zi and Wu Zi, the generations increased their enterprise.

sentences.zh: 魯文公卒，東門遂殺適立庶，魯君於是失國政。

translations.literal: Lu Wen Gong died, Dong Men Sui killed proper established concubine-born, Lu lord from this lost state government.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Wen of Lu died, Dong Men Sui killed the legitimate heir and established the concubine-born. The Lu lord from this lost the state government.

sentences.zh: 政在季氏，於今四君矣。

translations.literal: Government in Ji clan, to now four lords.
translations.idiomatic: The government has been in the Ji clan for four lords now.

sentences.zh: 民不知君，何以得國！

translations.literal: People not know lord, how obtain state!
translations.idiomatic: If the people do not know their lord, how can he obtain the state!

sentences.zh: 是以為君慎器與名，不可以假人。」

translations.literal: Therefore for lord careful vessels and names, cannot lend people.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, as lord, be careful with vessels and names. They cannot be lent to others.'

sentences.zh: 定公五年，季平子卒。

translations.literal: Ding Gong fifth year, Ji Ping Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ding's fifth year, Ji Ping Zi died.

sentences.zh: 陽虎私怒，囚季桓子，與盟，乃捨之。

translations.literal: Yang Hu privately angered, imprisoned Ji Huan Zi, made covenant with him, then released him.
translations.idiomatic: Yang Hu was privately angered, imprisoned Ji Huan Zi, made a covenant with him, and then released him.

sentences.zh: 七年，齊伐我，取鄆，以為魯陽虎邑以從政。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Qi attacked us, took Yun, made it Yang Hu's city for Lu to conduct government.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Qi attacked us and took Yun, making it Yang Hu's city for conducting government in Lu.

sentences.zh: 八年，陽虎欲盡殺三桓適，而更立其所善庶子以代之；

translations.literal: Eighth year, Yang Hu desired completely kill three Huan proper heirs, and replace establish his favored concubine-born sons to substitute them;
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Yang Hu desired to completely kill the three Huan legitimate heirs and replace them by establishing his favored concubine-born sons;

sentences.zh: 載季桓子將殺之，桓子詐而得脫。

translations.literal: Loaded Ji Huan Zi about to kill him, Huan Zi deceived and obtained escape.
translations.idiomatic: He loaded Ji Huan Zi (in a cart) intending to kill him, but Huan Zi deceived him and escaped.

sentences.zh: 三桓共攻陽虎，陽虎居陽關。

translations.literal: Three Huan together attacked Yang Hu, Yang Hu resided Yang Pass.
translations.idiomatic: The three Huan together attacked Yang Hu, and Yang Hu resided at Yang Pass.

sentences.zh: 九年，魯伐陽虎，陽虎奔齊，已而奔晉趙氏。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Lu attacked Yang Hu, Yang Hu fled Qi, already then fled Jin Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Lu attacked Yang Hu. Yang Hu fled to Qi, and then fled to the Zhao clan in Jin.

sentences.zh: 十年，定公與齊景公會於夾谷，孔子行相事。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Ding Gong with Qi Jing Gong assembled at Jia Gu, Kong Qiu performed assistant affairs.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Duke Ding assembled with Duke Jing of Qi at Jia Gu, and Kong Qiu performed the assistant's duties.

sentences.zh: 齊欲襲魯君，孔子以禮歷階，誅齊淫樂，齊侯懼，乃止，歸魯侵地而謝過。

translations.literal: Qi desired attack Lu lord, Kong Qiu with rites ascended steps, executed Qi lewd music, Qi Hou feared, then stopped, returned Lu invaded lands and apologized for offense.
translations.idiomatic: Qi desired to attack the Lu lord. Kong Qiu, with rites, ascended the steps, executed Qi's lewd music. The Qi lord feared and stopped, returning the Lu invaded lands and apologizing for the offense.

sentences.zh: 十二年，使仲由毀三桓城，收其甲兵。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, made Zhong You destroy three Huan cities, collected their armor weapons.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he had Zhong You destroy the three Huan cities and collect their armor and weapons.

sentences.zh: 孟氏不肯墮城，伐之，不克而止。

translations.literal: Meng clan not willing demolish city, attacked them, not conquered and stopped.
translations.idiomatic: The Meng clan was not willing to demolish the city. He attacked them but did not conquer and stopped.

sentences.zh: 季桓子受齊女樂，孔子去。

translations.literal: Ji Huan Zi accepted Qi female music, Kong Qiu left.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Huan Zi accepted Qi female musicians. Kong Qiu left.

sentences.zh: 十五年，定公卒，子將立，是為哀公。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, Ding Gong died, son Jiang ascended, this was Ai Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Duke Ding died, and his son Jiang ascended as Duke Ai.

sentences.zh: 哀公五年，齊景公卒。

translations.literal: Ai Gong fifth year, Qi Jing Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ai's fifth year, Duke Jing of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 六年，齊田乞弒其君孺子。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Qi Tian Qi assassinated their lord Ru Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Qi's Tian Qi assassinated their lord Ru Zi.

sentences.zh: 七年，吳王夫差彊，伐齊，至繒，徵百牢於魯。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Wu Wang Fu Cha strong, attacked Qi, arrived Zeng, demanded hundred cattle at Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, King Fu Cha of Wu was strong. He attacked Qi, arrived at Zeng, and demanded a hundred cattle from Lu.

sentences.zh: 季康子使子貢說吳王及太宰嚭，以禮詘之。

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi made Zi Gong persuade Wu Wang and Tai Zai Pi, with rites subdue them.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Kang Zi had Zi Gong persuade King Wu and Tai Zai Pi, subduing them with rites.

sentences.zh: 吳王曰：「我文身，不足責禮。」

translations.literal: Wu Wang said: 'I tattoo body, not worth demand rites.'
translations.idiomatic: The Wu king said: 'I have a tattooed body. It is not worth demanding rites from me.'

sentences.zh: 乃止。

translations.literal: Then stopped.
translations.idiomatic: They then stopped.

sentences.zh: 吳為鄒伐魯，至城下，盟而去。

translations.literal: Wu for Zou attacked Lu, arrived city walls, allied and left.
translations.idiomatic: Wu, for Zou's sake, attacked Lu, arrived at the city walls, made an alliance, and left.

sentences.zh: 齊伐我，取三邑。

translations.literal: Qi attacked us, took three cities.
translations.idiomatic: Qi attacked us and took three cities.

sentences.zh: 十年，伐齊南邊。

translations.literal: Tenth year, attacked Qi southern border.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, they attacked Qi's southern border.

sentences.zh: 齊伐魯。

translations.literal: Qi attacked Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Qi attacked Lu.

sentences.zh: 季氏用冉有有功，思孔子，孔子自衛歸魯。

translations.literal: Ji clan used Ran You had merit, thought of Kong Qiu, Kong Qiu from Wei returned Lu.
translations.idiomatic: The Ji clan used Ran You and had merit. They thought of Kong Qiu, and Kong Qiu returned to Lu from Wei.

sentences.zh: 齊田常弒其君簡公於俆州。

translations.literal: Qi Tian Chang assassinated their lord Jian Gong at Xu Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Qi's Tian Chang assassinated their lord Duke Jian at Xu Zhou.

sentences.zh: 孔子請伐之，哀公不聽。

translations.literal: Kong Qiu requested attack them, Ai Gong not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Qiu requested to attack them, but Duke Ai did not listen.

sentences.zh: 十五年，使子服景伯、子貢為介，適齊，齊歸我侵地。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, made Zi Fu Jing Bo, Zi Gong be intermediaries, went to Qi, Qi returned our invaded lands.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, he had Zi Fu Jing Bo and Zi Gong act as intermediaries, went to Qi, and Qi returned our invaded lands.

sentences.zh: 田常初相，欲親諸侯。

translations.literal: Tian Chang initially prime minister, desired close feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang, initially prime minister, desired to be close to the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 十六年，孔子卒。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Kong Qiu died.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Kong Qiu died.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，越王句踐滅吳王夫差。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, Yue Wang Gou Jian extinguished Wu Wang Fu Cha.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, King Gou Jian of Yue extinguished King Fu Cha of Wu.

sentences.zh: 二十七年春，季康子卒。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year spring, Ji Kang Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, spring, Ji Kang Zi died.

sentences.zh: 夏，哀公患三桓，將欲因諸侯以劫之，三桓亦患公作難，故君臣多閒。

translations.literal: Summer, Ai Gong worried three Huan, about to desire use feudal lords to coerce them, three Huan also worried duke make difficulty, therefore lord minister many estrangements.
translations.idiomatic: In summer, Duke Ai worried about the three Huan and was about to use the feudal lords to coerce them. The three Huan also worried the duke would make difficulties, so lord and ministers had many estrangements.

sentences.zh: 公游于陵阪，遇孟武伯於街，曰：「請問余及死乎？」

translations.literal: Gong strolled at Ling Ban, encountered Meng Wu Bo at street, said: 'Please ask will I reach death?'
translations.idiomatic: The duke strolled at Ling Ban and encountered Meng Wu Bo on the street, saying: 'Please tell me, will I reach death?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不知也。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Not know.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied, saying: 'I do not know.'

sentences.zh: 公欲以越伐三桓。

translations.literal: Gong desired with Yue attack three Huan.
translations.idiomatic: The duke desired to use Yue to attack the three Huan.

sentences.zh: 八月，哀公如陘氏。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Ai Gong went to Xing Shi.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, Duke Ai went to the Xing family.

sentences.zh: 三桓攻公，公奔于衛，去如鄒，遂如越。

translations.literal: Three Huan attacked duke, duke fled to Wei, left went to Zou, then went to Yue.
translations.idiomatic: The three Huan attacked the duke. The duke fled to Wei, then went to Zou, and finally went to Yue.

sentences.zh: 國人迎哀公復歸，卒于有山氏。

translations.literal: State people welcomed Ai Gong return again, died at You Shan Shi.
translations.idiomatic: The people of the state welcomed Duke Ai to return again, but he died at the You Shan family.

sentences.zh: 子寧立，是為悼公。

translations.literal: Son Ning ascended, this was Dao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: His son Ning ascended, who became Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 悼公之時，三桓勝，魯如小侯，卑於三桓之家。

translations.literal: Dao Gong time, three Huan victorious, Lu like small marquis, lowly compared to three Huan families.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Dao's time, the three Huan were victorious. Lu was like a small marquis, lowly compared to the three Huan families.

sentences.zh: 十三年，三晉滅智伯，分其地有之。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, three Jin extinguished Zhi Bo, divided his land possessed it.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, the three Jin extinguished Zhi Bo and divided his land among themselves.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，悼公卒，子嘉立，是為元公。

translations.literal: Thirty-seventh year, Dao Gong died, son Jia ascended, this was Yuan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, Duke Dao died, and his son Jia ascended as Duke Yuan.

sentences.zh: 元公二十一年卒，子顯立，是為穆公。

translations.literal: Yuan Gong twenty-first year died, son Xian ascended, this was Mu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Yuan died in his twenty-first year, and his son Xian ascended as Duke Mu.

sentences.zh: 穆公三十三年卒，子奮立，是為共公。

translations.literal: Mu Gong thirty-third year died, son Fen ascended, this was Gong Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu died in his thirty-third year, and his son Fen ascended as Duke Gong.

sentences.zh: 共公二十二年卒，子屯立，是為康公。

translations.literal: Gong Gong twenty-second year died, son Tun ascended, this was Kang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Gong died in his twenty-second year, and his son Tun ascended as Duke Kang.

sentences.zh: 康公九年卒，子匽立，是為景公。

translations.literal: Kang Gong ninth year died, son Yan ascended, this was Jing Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Kang died in his ninth year, and his son Yan ascended as Duke Jing.

sentences.zh: 景公二十九年卒，子叔立，是為平公。

translations.literal: Jing Gong twenty-ninth year died, son Shu ascended, this was Ping Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing died in his twenty-ninth year, and his son Shu ascended as Duke Ping.

sentences.zh: 是時六國皆稱王。

translations.literal: At this time six states all called wang.
translations.idiomatic: At this time the six states all called themselves wang.

sentences.zh: 平公十二年，秦惠王卒。

translations.literal: Ping Gong twelfth year, Qin Hui Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ping's twelfth year, King Hui of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 二十（二）年，平公卒，子賈立，是為文公。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, Ping Gong died, son Jia ascended, this was Wen Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Duke Ping died, and his son Jia ascended as Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公（七）［元］年，楚懷王死于秦。

translations.literal: Wen Gong first year, Chu Huai Wang died in Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Wen's first year, King Huai of Chu died in Qin.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，文公卒，子讎立，是為頃公。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, Wen Gong died, son Chou ascended, this was Qing Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Duke Wen died, and his son Chou ascended as Duke Qing.

sentences.zh: 頃公二年，秦拔楚之郢，楚頃王東徙于陳。

translations.literal: Qing Gong second year, Qin captured Chu's Ying, Chu Qing Wang east moved to Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Qing's second year, Qin captured Chu's Ying, and King Qing of Chu moved east to Chen.

sentences.zh: 十九年，楚伐我，取徐州。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Chu attacked us, took Xu Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Chu attacked us and took Xu Zhou.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，楚考烈王伐滅魯。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, Chu Kao Lie Wang attacked extinguished Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, King Kao Lie of Chu attacked and extinguished Lu.

sentences.zh: 頃公亡，遷於下邑，為家人，魯絕祀。

translations.literal: Qing Gong perished, moved to lower city, became commoner, Lu cut off sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing perished, moved to a lower city, became a commoner, and Lu's sacrifices were cut off.

sentences.zh: 頃公卒于柯。

translations.literal: Qing Gong died at Ke.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing died at Ke.

sentences.zh: 魯起周公至頃公，凡三十四世。

translations.literal: Lu from Zhou Gong to Qing Gong, altogether thirty-four generations.
translations.idiomatic: From the Duke of Zhou to Duke Qing, Lu had altogether thirty-four generations.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余聞孔子稱曰「甚矣魯道之衰也！

translations.literal: Grand Scribe said: I heard Kong Qiu say 'Extreme indeed Lu way decline!
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Scribe said: I heard Kong Qiu say 'How extreme is Lu's way in decline!

sentences.zh: 洙泗之閒龂龂如也」。

translations.literal: Zhu Si between argumentative like.'
translations.idiomatic: Between Zhu and Si, it is argumentative like that.'

sentences.zh: 觀慶父及叔牙閔公之際，何其亂也？

translations.literal: Observe Qing Fu and Shu Ya Min Gong time, how chaotic?
translations.idiomatic: Observe the time of Qing Fu and Shu Ya with Duke Min, how chaotic was it?

sentences.zh: 隱桓之事；

translations.literal: Yin Huan matters;
translations.idiomatic: The matters of Yin and Huan;

sentences.zh: 襄仲殺適立庶；

translations.literal: Xiang Zhong killed proper established concubine-born;
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zhong killed the legitimate heir and established the concubine-born;

sentences.zh: 三家北面為臣，親攻昭公，昭公以奔。

translations.literal: Three houses north face became ministers, personally attacked Zhao Gong, Zhao Gong therefore fled.
translations.idiomatic: The three houses faced north as ministers, personally attacked Duke Zhao, and Duke Zhao therefore fled.

sentences.zh: 至其揖讓之禮則從矣，而行事何其戾也？

translations.literal: To their yielding courtesy rites then followed, but actions how perverse?
translations.idiomatic: To their yielding courtesy rites they then followed, but their actions how perverse?
